comments: It seems that (n-sum(k=1,n,a(k))/log(n) is bounded - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 03 20022^a(n) is the highest power of 2 dividing the n-th triangular number n*(n+1)/2 - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 03 2002
maple: nmax:=80; with(Bits): add3c := proc(a, b) option remember; if(0 = And(a, b)) then RETURN(0); else RETURN(1+add3c(Xor(a, b), 2*And(a, b))); fi; end: for n from 0 to nmax do a(n):=add3c(n,2) od: seq(a(n),n=0..nmax); [From _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 18 2009]
